Baby red dragons are located in the Brimhaven Dungeon. They only attack with magic.

Low-level players seeking baby dragon bones often choose to fight baby blue dragons instead as aggressive wild dogs and 875 coins to gain entry to the area deters many players. However, wild dogs are not aggressive to players with 71+ combat. These monsters, like all chromatic dragons, are best attacked using ranged attacks.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.
Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Key token1RareNot soldNot alchemisable
Mimic kill token (m)11/10,00095,216Not alchemisable

Graphical updates[edit | edit source]

  • Baby red dragon after 29 March 2004 (update)

  • Baby red dragon after 28 April 2013

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 6 October 2010 (Update):
    • Fixed a problem with baby red dragon animations.
  • update 5 July 2010 (Update):
    • Graphical overhaul to chromatics, including baby variants.
  • update 27 February 2002 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • When you attack the baby red dragon it strikes a pose remarkably similar to Y Ddraig Goch, the dragon on the Welsh Flag.
